title: FY360° | Understanding blockchain and the opportunity for financial institutions
text: FY360° | Understanding blockchain and the opportunity for financial institutions So much emphasis is now placed on our world being digitised, from our social interactions to how we browse and purchase items, to capturing our experiences via live streaming apps and photo-sharing sites to mention just a few. It was only a matter of time until money also went digital, writes Tony Virdi. articles liés FY360° | The Audacity of Holacracy Big financial transactions have been virtual for a long time, moving around the world via banking and corporate systems, tallied up in spreadsheets or as loans. Now, however, we are seeing how everyday money and currencies are going digital with the rise of cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin – as an alternative to ‘hard cash’. The Wall Street Journal recently called Bitcoin “one of the most powerful innovations in finance in 500 years” while the currency was recently deemed a commodity in the US. Crucially, the technology that underpins Bitcoin, Blockchain, has the potential to transform centuries old mechanisms for transferring money. Our latest research,...
